BackstoryDef.title: Khan Warlord's Son
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born into the leadership of the Great Khans, son of a previous Khan. [PAWN_pronoun] grew up hearing stories of past glories and devastating defeats at the hands of the NCR. From childhood, [PAWN_pronoun] was trained to be a warrior and leader, learning the Khan way of strength, freedom, and loyalty to the tribe above all else.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Leader
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became Papa Khan, leader of the Great Khans. [PAWN_pronoun] led the tribe after their devastating defeat at Bitter Springs, where NCR forces massacred women, children, and elders. This tragedy hardened [PAWN_objective], making [PAWN_objective] bitter toward the NCR and deeply protective of what remained of [PAWN_possessive] people. [PAWN_pronoun] struggles between the Khan traditions of raiding and violence, and the need to ensure the tribe's survival in a changing wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Thoughtful Youth
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was always more contemplative than the average Khan youth. While other children gloried in tales of battle, [PAWN_pronoun] paid attention to why battles were won or lost. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to read and studied what few books the Khans possessed, understanding that brains could be as valuable as brawn.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Advisor
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became an advisor to Papa Khan, serving as a voice of reason and long-term thinking. [PAWN_pronoun] witnessed the Bitter Springs Massacre and understood that continuing the old ways would only lead to extinction. [PAWN_pronoun] advocated for evolution - maintaining Khan identity while adapting to survive. Some saw [PAWN_objective] as weak, but [PAWN_pronoun] understood that true strength meant ensuring the tribe's future.

BackstoryDef.title: Bitter Springs Survivor
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] survived the Bitter Springs Massacre as a teenager. [PAWN_pronoun] watched NCR troopers gun down [PAWN_possessive] friends and family members who were fleeing toward safety. The trauma of that day burned itself into [PAWN_possessive] soul, creating an unquenchable hatred for the NCR and everyone who wore the bear.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Warrior
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became one of the Great Khans' fiercest warriors, driven by the need for revenge against the NCR. [PAWN_pronoun] trained relentlessly, becoming skilled with multiple weapons. [PAWN_possessive] hatred ran so deep that [PAWN_pronoun] opposed any suggestion of peace or cooperation with the bear. For [PAWN_objective], there could be no forgiveness for Bitter Springs.

BackstoryDef.title: Scavenger's Apprentice
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] learned to work with metal and machinery from a young age. While other Khan children played at being raiders, [PAWN_pronoun] was fascinated by how things worked. [PAWN_pronoun] collected scrap and learned to turn it into useful items, developing skills that would prove valuable to the tribe.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Armorer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became the Great Khans' primary armorer, maintaining weapons and crafting armor from whatever materials could be scavenged. [PAWN_pronoun] took pride in [PAWN_possessive] work, knowing that quality gear could mean the difference between life and death for [PAWN_possessive] fellow Khans. [PAWN_pronoun] dreamed of obtaining better tools and materials to improve the tribe's equipment.

BackstoryDef.title: Chemistry Prodigy
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] showed an early aptitude for mixing chemicals and understanding reactions. The Khan chem-makers noticed [PAWN_possessive] talent and began teaching [PAWN_objective] the secrets of their trade. [PAWN_pronoun] learned that chems weren't just products - they were the tribe's primary source of income and survival.

BackstoryDef.title: Chem Dealer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became one of the Great Khans' master chem-makers and dealers. [PAWN_pronoun] produced high-quality psycho, jet, and other chems that kept caps flowing into the tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] understood the business side of the trade, negotiating with buyers and maintaining supply chains. Some questioned the morality of spreading addiction, but [PAWN_pronoun] saw it as survival - the Khans had little else to trade.

BackstoryDef.title: Street Kid
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] wasn't born into the Khans - [PAWN_pronoun] was a wasteland kid who survived through cunning and opportunism. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to talk [PAWN_possessive] way out of trouble and to spot weaknesses in others. When the Khans found [PAWN_objective], [PAWN_pronoun] saw a chance for something better than living hand to mouth.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Recruiter
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became a recruiter for the Great Khans, seeking out potential members among wasteland outcasts and troublemakers. [PAWN_pronoun] had a gift for identifying those who would thrive in Khan culture and convincing them to join. [PAWN_pronoun] wasn't the best fighter, but [PAWN_possessive] ability to bring in fresh blood made [PAWN_objective] valuable. Some called [PAWN_objective] "Jerry the Punk" for [PAWN_possessive] cocky attitude.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Born
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born and raised in the Great Khans, learning their ways from birth. [PAWN_pronoun] grew up hearing stories of past raids and victories, idolizing the warriors who fought the NCR. [PAWN_pronoun] trained hard to prove [PAWN_pronoun] could be just as tough as the legends.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Guard
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] served as a guard for the Great Khans, protecting the camp and standing watch against threats. [PAWN_pronoun] took [PAWN_possessive] duties seriously, understanding that vigilance kept the tribe safe. [PAWN_pronoun] was loyal to Papa Khan and followed orders without question, embodying the traditional Khan values of strength and loyalty.

BackstoryDef.title: Raider's Son
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up learning the raider lifestyle - taking what you need and surviving by strength. [PAWN_pronoun] participated in [PAWN_possessive] first raid as a young teenager, learning that violence was sometimes necessary for survival. The Khan way of life felt natural to [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Warrior
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became a respected warrior among the Great Khans. [PAWN_pronoun] participated in numerous raids and battles, earning [PAWN_possessive] place through combat prowess. [PAWN_pronoun] believed in the old ways - that the strong should take what they need and the weak deserved their fate. [PAWN_pronoun] remained skeptical of softer approaches to survival.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Wanderer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] youth wandering the wasteland with [PAWN_possessive] family, never staying in one place long. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to navigate dangerous terrain and read situations quickly. When [PAWN_possessive] family was killed by raiders, the Khans took [PAWN_objective] in.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Raider
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became a Great Khan raider, participating in operations across the Mojave. [PAWN_pronoun] wasn't the most skilled fighter, but [PAWN_pronoun] was reliable and followed orders. [PAWN_pronoun] sometimes questioned whether the raiding lifestyle was sustainable, but kept those doubts to [PAWN_pronoun]self. [PAWN_pronoun] owed the Khans for taking [PAWN_objective] in when [PAWN_pronoun] had nothing.

BackstoryDef.title: Orphan Recruit
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was orphaned young and survived on the streets until the Great Khans recruited [PAWN_objective]. The tribe gave [PAWN_objective] purpose, training, and a new family. [PAWN_pronoun] eagerly embraced Khan culture, grateful for a place to belong and determined to prove [PAWN_possessive] worth.

BackstoryDef.title: Khan Soldier
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] served the Great Khans as a loyal soldier, fighting in raids and defending the camp. [PAWN_pronoun] was still relatively young and eager to prove [PAWN_pronoun] could be as fierce as the veteran warriors. [PAWN_pronoun] idolized Papa Khan and the other leaders, seeing them as the family [PAWN_pronoun] never had. [PAWN_possessive] loyalty to the tribe was absolute.
